115.title: Custom Character set #2

1153.content:
Neil had just made it to the alley that comprised the short cut home from his place of work for the summer, the Never Sets 24 hour convenience store. He had a bit of a late shift, and also had to run a few errands for his family before heading home, which meant it was fairly dark as he approached the crack in the old wooden fence. The alley started off pretty narrow, almost squeezing any who walked through it between two stone gray buildings. However, after the first few paces, it opened up considerably. The cold stone on each side diverted away, revealing small patches of green grass, some of which were equipped with an inviting bench calling any who wished to rest in this most unexpected sanctuary.

As he passed by, one of the benches caught his attention, something was strange about it, but with the lack of light, it was hard to make out why. He decided to step of the pathway and take a look. As his foot quietly rustled the grass, a somewhat noisy clang came from the bench. He was caught off guard by the sound and stood still, squinting to see what was going on. Fortunately, his eyes had become more used to the darkness of the alleyway; it looked like there was someone on the bench. They appeared to be fiddling with something.

"Don't think I've seen anyone else in here before."

After that brief aside to himself, he pressed forward, curious as to who was there and what they were doing. Whoever it was was so engrossed in their task that they didn't notice Neil at all. As he got closer he saw that the person had long, silver looking hair in a pony tail. It was probably a woman. Another clang came from the bench, and Neil's curiosity grew once more. Finally, he was right behind the person, and trying not to be rude, whispered to her.

"Hi, I don't think I've..."

His attempted greeting went awry from the start. The person on the bench let out a small shriek of surprise and threw her arms up in the air. At that, Neil jumped back and tried to apologize for scaring her.

"Sorry, I didn't..."

He was cut short, something dug into his shoulder as he spoke. It felt heavy, and sharp, like a dagger. Before he could even think, Neil began to lose track of his senses and his thoughts, and soon fell to ground unconscious.
1153.title: somone else?

11531.content:
"You should be able to awaken now, please get up."

The voice brought Neil out of his trance. As his vision cleared, he could see a figure looking down at him, it was the woman from before.

"What happened?"

He asked in a weak, groggy voice. The look on the woman's face bothered Neil, she was clearly upset about something. She sighed before giving her reply.

"I won't drag this out, the vile I was carrying contained the physical essence of another body. When you startled me, it flew from my grasp and landed in you. Since you have no ability to manipulate ether, it overwhelmed your form."

Just hearing that gave Neil a headache. He thought to himself that he must not have heard something right.

"I'm going to have to take you with me now. It will make things clearer, and don't worry about this world, your leaving it will not have many effects.

As Neil struggled to gain some kind of understanding from those words, the woman lifted a pendent lying on her chest; it began to produce a faint green light, and then suddenly, it released a tremendous flash. The light seemed to stay on for a while, but eventually Neil realized that what he was seeing was not the light of the jewel, but of the Sun. It had somehow become broad daylight.

"What? What happened?"

"This is Aldeltia, the land that I come from. The people of this world have a great understanding of the ether." As the woman said this, Neil finally got his first good look at her. She was older than him, maybe twenty, and had strange silver colored hair tied in a ponytail. Her clothes were somewhat odd, but looked expensive. Neil still wasn't following what she was saying, but he felt so weak and tired that he just went along with it.

"We should be able to return you to normal. However, your absorbing the essence from that vile is a serious problem."

The woman briefly glanced over her shoulder, then turned back to Neil, biting her lower lip.

"I will take you somewhere to rest, then we can decide on what to do."

Neil simply passed out again after that.

He woke up in yet another place, no longer in the woman's arms, but laying on something soft. Upon opening his eyes, he saw some bright white silk all around. He was in one of those fancy beds with its own curtains all around. Neil finally felt good enough to sit up, and did so, but as soon as he did, he heard something outside.

"There's activity in the room, she is awake."

The sound of a door practically being kicked open swiftly followed, through the silk curtains, Neil could see some figures approaching. A hand appeared between the two silk curtains, and parted them, revealing an old man who looked something like a doctor.

"Good day, as the transfusion of ether that lead to your body being altered was not intentional, we must very carefully examine you. Please bear with us for a while."

Altered? What did he mean? Neil thought to himself.

"Um, I'm sorry, I really don't get..."

Neil noticed that his voice was way off, he couldn't even get it to sound like that when your tried on purpose in the past. The doctor just looked on, with an expression that looked half amused, another man was now behind him, perhaps an assistant.

"What's wrong with my voice?"

Then Neil noticed that his voice wasn't just wrong, it sounded like a girl's.

"Hey, hey, hey" he said to test his voice. "What? I sound, almost like a girl!"

The old doctor made a light chuckle, and then turned around to face his assistant, who handed him something.

"That is because, you are a girl."

Neil shook your head when he heard this.

"What did you say?"

No answer came from his mouth, instead he only turned and rested a stethoscope on your chest.

"Wah!"

It was cold, very cold. In fact, Neil never felt one as bad as this. He immediately recoiled and crossed his arms over his chest. It actually felt a little sensitive, but he brushed it off and scowled at the doctor.

"What did you do to that? Dip it in ice water?"

The expression of amusement returned to the doctor's face returned.

"Don't worry it is a good sign, your body seems to have developed healthy nerves. But I think, it's best that you actually find out what happened."

He called for his assistant, who brought over a small mirror.

"This is you."

The assistant placed the mirror in front of Neil, but in place of his face, complete with boyish short black hair and brown eyes, Neil saw some girl with a amazingly abundant wavy brown hair and bright green eyes.

"What do you mean that's me?"

Sure enough, as he said that, the girl in the mirror did the same, and the only voice Neil heard, was not his own, but clearly female and perfectly fitting to the girl staring back at him from the mirror. It caused him to go into a bit of a panic.

"What happened? Where am I? Is this a dream or something?"

"No, this is a serious predicament. We need you to cooperate with us."

Neil turned and saw the woman from before.

"You! What was in that thing you stabbed me with? What did you do?"

"I didn't stab you." She said with a slightly annoyed tone before making an apologetic look and coming closer to you. "I hadn't noticed you, and when you came up behind me, I was so surprised that I lost my grip on it and threw it into the air."

While Neil pretty much agreed that that was what happened, it felt easier for him to blame her, and so he didn't let off glaring at her in the least.

"I know, I'm sorry, but it can be fixed. We just need you to help us first."

Help? Neil didn't know why you should help them with anything after what happened to him.

"Why should I do anything after being turned into this?" Neil said pointing to himself.

"No one will recognize me, and I can't even get over my own reflection. Did you have to make me a girl?"

The woman looked slightly more impatient after Neil's little outburst. She pushed herself through the bed curtains and leaned on the mattress with one knee.

"I said that it was an accident. I didn't come to cause you any problems."

She was almost scary, so Neil decided not to snap at her for now.

"In any case, what's done is done. The reason you're in that body is because it is the body of the princess of the caves. She is the one who must communicate with the incarnations of the ether on behalf of all of our people. Without her, we cannot fully understand the ether's feelings and will. Lately the incarnations have seemed angry. We were counting of the princess to calm them, but something went wrong. We barely managed to save her. In the mean time, the incarnations became more and more wild. We ended up forging a new essence to inject into her body to restore it to health, but it ended up in you, and changed you. That's why you are the girl you see in your current reflection."

She reached out with her hand and grabbed Neil's.

"Please, we need you to take on the role of the princess. You will be a hero to everyone, surely you see out plight? We only need you to remain like this until the true princess is healed."

Before Neil could answer, if he was even going to, the doctor interjected.

"Well, I'm sure that's enough to chew on for now, but we must finish here, so if you would kindly wait outside while we work."

The woman nodded and left.
11531.title: continue

115311.content:
Neil had quite an experience going through his examination. Usually, the person being examined is the one most familiar with their body, but it was not so in this situation.

In any case, the doctors determined that his body was in tact, and they invited the woman from before to return inside as they left. She approached Neil and continued to explain after properly introducing herself for the first time.

"My name is Cille, I am an ether-caster."

Neil was still upset, but he could clearly see that Cille was sorry for what had happened and was trying to be nice, he deiced to act in kind.

"I'm Neil, um, a part time convenience store worker."

"Neil, I know that you are confused by all of this, so I will explain the situation to you, if you are ready."

Neil nodded.

"The last princess of the caves was Tiahara of the royal family. Over the course of the past months, she noted that something was disturbing the ether. She went to the southern caves intending to communicate with its incarnations, but for some reason, they responded violently. We do not know what happened exactly, as usually no one but the princess may enter the caves. I was part of her escort waiting outside. When the ground began shaking, we became concerned. Soon afterward, the caves themselves shook terribly, some of the nearby rock formations even began to collapse. The princess never emerged, so we knew that we would have to go in and find her. After a short while navigating the collapsing underground passages, we found her badly injured on the ground. We almost thought that she had been killed."

Neil could not help but feel Cille's pain in retelling the story. She was clearly explaining this for his sake, as she had seen it first hand and probably wished to forget it. Cille paused for a brief while, bringing her sad gaze up towards the roof of the bed that she was sitting on. Neil almost wanted to reach out to her, though there wasn't really anything he could do, and he could tell that Cille wasn't finished. She had paused only to collect herself enough to continue telling the story.

"It was then that I saw the incarnations for the first time. I had always imagined them as being benevolent, divine being, however what I saw could not be described in such a way. When I caught my first glimpse, I did not even think that the creatures I saw could be incarnations of the ether that brings us life and happiness. They were monsters, cold and dark. A faint white glow ran through their figures, outlining their body, their arms, their legs, and their heads; it resembled a skeleton, only it was one continuous thing. Around this was some form of transparent flesh, deep purple in color, nearly black. It distorted the skeletons underneath, making them look like a pack of apparitions."

Cille stopped for a brief moment once again.

"This flesh seemed to be burning off - when ever they moved, I could see a shadow of where they had previous been, but it always broke apart and disintegrated into the air like paper turns to ash when thrown into a fire. The sight of these things terrified me. After I saw them, parading around slamming into the walls, the floor, and roof; I didn't move until someone else grabbed me by the arm and dragged me away."


Cille turned back to Neil, his face was full of fear and confusion. She reached out with her hand, and took his.

"I don't mean to frighten you, but you must know what you will face as the princess. No one else but you can face the incarnations now. No one is allowed into the cave besides the incarnations because they, despite being so monstrous in appearance, seem to fear what they do not know. They will only recognize a handful of people at once, all others will be attacked. I myself did not know this until after I had seen them myself, only then was I, and those with me who had seen the incarnations, allowed to know all about them."

"What do I have to do? Fight them?" Neil was left uncertain about being able to confront something as terrible as these incarnations. He felt that beasts so terrible would only kill him, and he felt even weaker in his new body, with its soft quiet voice.

" The incarnations are being through which people can communicate with the ether. All we need you to do is ask find out from them how well we are using the ether, are we being wasteful? destructive? careless? We cannot know unless the princess goes to them. It is as I have told you, lately they have not been pleased. We are doing something wrong, and we need to find out before something terrible befalls us."

Suddenly, Cille moved back towards the edge of the bed, and stood up. She turned away from Neil, and slowly slid away towards the door.

"You should understand now. In the coming days, you will be prepared for this mission. I'm sorry that because of me, you must go through with this, but I personally will ensure that something is done to repay you."

She left as soon as she finished speaking. Neil was now alone, left to ponder all that he had taken in. Cille had sounded so sincere, but she had also instilled a fear in Neil. The incarnations were not trifle matter; Neil did not know if he was willing to go through with the ordeal. Already, he missed his simple life, even more than the body he had lost.
115311.title: The doctors continue

1153112.content:
Just by hearing Cille's explanation, Neil had become quite drained. He turned over and attempted to sleep, however, his new figure made that uncomfortable, so he had no choice but to lay on his back.

Neil slept for quite some time, the entire day past before he woke up. He had nearly forgotten about his predicament in his sleep and almost fell over when he looked in the mirror that morning.

"So I guess this is reality."

Neil went over to the door, he wanted to find the bathroom and go through his usually prep for the day, but he soon realized that he didn't know where anything was. But just then, the door flung itself open, nearly slamming into Neil's face.

"Neil, I am Lutethar, the head of security of this palace. You will need to be trained before you can be sent out to do your job. I will see to it that you are ready."

The booming voice only grew louder until a large man entered the room. He wore a silver helmet and some kind of armored vest that was partially covered by his impressive white beard. It was clear that the man, apparently called Lutethar, did not intend to give Neil room to speak.

"Now, due to the nature of the situation, it is very important that we begin training at once. I will bring you to the knights' barracks where you will be prepared and then brought into the field to hone your abilities."

Neil was caught off guard by this approach and began to have second thoughts on agreeing to be the princess.

"Wait, this is a bit fast isn't it? I'm not even used to seeing this body yet!"

He grabbed his throat.

"And I get freaked out by my own voice too. I..."

"These are all things that will be put behind you. A good warrior can overcome fears and anxieties."

The man firmly placed his fist over his chest.

"I will make you a good warrior."

Lutethar began to step closer, all the while seemingly becoming larger in Neil's terrified eyes. However, a now familiar voice interrupted, much to Neil's delight.

"Please wait sir."

Cille stepped in and bowed to Lutethar.

"I don't think that he is ready yet. Not just mentally, but physically. He must learn to use that body as if it was his own. Let me take him for a few days, then I will turn him over to you. This will make things quicker, I am sure of it."

Lutethar ran through his beard with one hand, while he placed the other behind his back.

"Hmmm, I do suppose that you may be right. If you so insist, I'll let you go through with it. Just do not forget what is at stake."

He gave what looked vaguely like a salute to Cille, who returned the gesture, and then exited promptly.

Neil fell back on the floor, trying to calm his pounding heart.

"Thank you! Who was that?"

"Like he said, he leads all the warriors here at the palace. Lutethar is one of the most talented soldiers this world has ever seen. But he's much less amazing in other areas like conversation."


Cille smiled and worked over to help Neil up. When he was on his feet, she covered his mouth and whispered into his ear.

"Now that we are alone, I can tell you what I really came here for."

She quickly stepped back towards the door and shut it quietly before returning to Neil's side.

"I still can't help but feel sorry for getting you into this, and I decided that I should do something for you before you go and confront the ether for our sake."

Neil's eyes widened.

"You probably miss your world. I can take you there and let you see your people once more before facing the incarnations. This will also help you become used to your body, so we will still be obeying Lutethar's orders."

Neil didn't need to hear anymore.

"Please take me there, I've only been gone for a short time, but I miss home so much."

Cille rested her hand on Neil's head.

"Yes, we can go shortly, but I must explain some things to you. Firstly, this is my doing, I did not ask for permission, so no one must find out. Second your world does not share time with this one, so we can go back to the moment you vanished as if you never left. This can only be done going to your world however, as we need to be linked to this world to travel. The link will be affected by time. Third, don't forget that no one will recognize you, so you need a new identity if you want to talk to anyone. Lastly, the longer we are there, the more people might notice your disappearance. Unless you can get around this, we might only be able to visit there for a limited time."

Neil merely nodded, no matter what needed to be done, he wanted to go back and experience his old life, hoping that it would not be the final the time.
1153112.title: Neil falls asleep

11531121.content:
Cille asked Neil if he wanted to take anything, but he just wanted to go home.

"Nothing, I'm ready now."

Cille knew how he felt, but could not let him act recklessly.

"Are you certain? Please don't careless make a mistake. What will we tell your family who will be looking for you?"

Neil's face drooped, but he knew that Cille was right. He turned around and began thinking.

"I can't speak to them... I know! I'll send them a text."

He turned to see Cille's confused face.

"What is a text?"

"Oh, well, uh..."

Neil soon realized that telling her exactly what it was wouldn't amount to much good, because she would probably then ask what a cell phone was. He hadn't been here long, but it seemed to a world built around magic, or ether, so he guessed it was like all those magical worlds he saw on TV.

"It's like a letter."

But upon saying that, he realized that he had not seen any of his possessions since he came here. He had kept his things in his pockets, but a quick look down reminded him that he was no longer in his own clothes.

"Cille, do you know where my clothes and things are? I'll need them to send the text."

She walked past him to a chest placed a corner of the room.

"Everything you had with you is in here."

She opened the chest and stepped aside.

Neil walked over and looked inside.

"It should be in my pocket here... Got it!"

He pulled out a small black phone.

"Now just in case..."

He reach in and searched his clothing, eventually taking out a ring of keys and his wallet.

"I think that this is all I need."

He looked back down at the chest.

"Well, it's probably all I have."

Cille smiled and grabbed his arm.

"So, you are ready to return to your world?"

Neil smiled back and gave a large nod.
11531121.title: They get ready to go

115311211.content:
Cille used her green pendant once again.

"Where do you want to go?"

Neil very briefly thought it over.

"Exactly where I was when I left."

Cille looked straight into his eyes.

"You are sure that this is the best time and place to go?"

Neil nodded firmly. He knew that he probably would not be able to see anyone, but it would give him some time to himself, just to feel more comfortable. Cille reached for her necklace. The pendant once again began to radiated its light, and suddenly the room was left empty. When the light receded, Neil saw nothing but perfect darkness.

"Cille?"

He felt a hand on his own.

"You are home."

Neil's sight adjusted. He was merely standing in the dark while his eyes were used to light. Soon, the bench where his adventure started came into view. A smile grew on the recently crowned princess's face. Neil turned and saw the paved path, the tame grass, and the pathway squeezed between the grey stony buildings. He truly was home.

Upon this realization, Neil began to sprint down the path in the same direction that he had been traveling earlier, but he did not keep his momentum. His legs slowed, and the hair flowing behind him fell back onto his neck and shoulders. He was not himself, and that meant he could not truly go home. His family would not accept him, at least not under the current circumstances.

"Maybe I could try to bump into them tomorrow during the day."

Neil felt something cradle him, and them turn him around. Cille shared the same sad look on his face.

"Not now. You will see them, but now. First, let's find a place to stay."
115311211.title: Cille brings him home

1153112111.content:
"Cille, I know where I'm going to go first."

Cille threw her weight forward and sat up on the ground.

"To your family?"

"No, not yet. It will be easier to see them later. I'm going to visit a friend."

Cille got up off the ground and offered a hand to Neil to pull him up.

"What will you call yourself? And what about me? I don't understand this world very well, so I shouldn't try to talk with anyone."

"I was thinking about that. I will tell you as we go."

Neil led Cille to a large park. They followed a trail through some trees and came to a small enclosed field. Within it was a girl kicking a soccer ball around. She was doing more than just playing, her breathing was heavy. She was working out pretty hard. Neil merely stood with Cille and watched the girl as she kicked the ball at some trees and then chased after it and kicked it again. After a bit of time, she missed one of her shots, and the ball came bouncing down the field towards Neil. The girl turned around and noticed that she had not been alone. When Neil saw her face, he lit up.

"Hello, sorry, we didn't mean to stare. We just happened to be walking through this place and noticed you playing."

Neil walked over to the girl with the ball in his hands.

"Nothing to worry about, I don't mind. Just getting a bit of exercise."

The girl looked over Neil and Cille quickly.

"I don't remember ever seeing you around here. Did you move from somewhere?"

Cille subtly looked over at Neil who presented the ball to the girl.

"It's more of a vacation. I'm not from here at all, I'm only briefly visiting."

The girl noticed the pair's rather exotic clothing and became curious.

"Where are from then? And my name is Analise!"

Neil cleared his throat, he was a little nervous, but there was no turning back now.

"I'm Nel, the princess of Andelta. This is my bodyguard, Cille."

Neil motioned toward Cille who hurriedly bowed after catching Neil's mispronunciation of Aldeltia.

"Wow, a real princess! I'm honored to meet you!"

"It's not a big deal Analise."

Neil caught himself acting a little too familiar with Analise, and tried to make something up to cover himself.

"I actually like to get away from being a princess from time to time. I really enjoy living a simpler life every now and then. That's why I'm here."

"Is it alright if I call you Nel then?"

Neil nodded although it still felt a little strange, even if his new name was almost the same as his old one. He was getting a bit worried about Analise asking about where he came from, and his supposed duties as a princess. Although he technically wasn't lieing, telling the truth probably wouldn't work out well. Neil decided to avoid the situation.

"Analise, is it alright if I join you? Your exercise looks like fun."

"Is it alright in that dress? I mean it looks valuable."

Even if Neil thought his clothing was valuable, it wouldn't have stopped him. He was so glad to be talking to a familiar face again and not worry about terrible monsters. In the corner of his eye, another tear began to form, but he closed his eyes and hid it.

"It's not a problem. This dress isn't really all that special."

Analise giggled a little and motioned for "Nel" to follow her. The two girls laughed as the played together, and Cille couldn't help but smile as she looked on.
1153112111.title: In the morning

11531121111.content:
Time passed quickly. As the sun began to set, Neil found himself standing next to Analise on a hill watching the fading twilight. Both of them were silent, simply waiting for the sun to retire for the day. When it finally fell below the horizon, Analise let herself fall backwards and land on the grassy hillside.

"It's hard to believe that I've been out here so long. I just met you Nel, but it doesn't feel that way."

Neil set himself down next to Analise.

"Is that so? I feel the same way. Maybe we used to do things like this in another life."

Laughter broke out between the two. It steadily faded into silent smiles, which prompted Analise to stand up.

"I had a lot of fun today Nel. I kind of wish I could run into someone like you everyday."

"I'll remember than Analise. I'll be leaving here very soon, but I'll make sure that you'll have more days like this."

Analise walked behind Neil, and moved around until she was to his left.

"Don't let me get in the way of your duties as a princess. I'll wait until you can come back."

Nel walked up to Analise and hugged her.

"I'll miss you, Analise."

Later than night, Neil and Cille were wandering through town looking for a place to sleep. They had left the park, saying that Nel had to attend to a meeting with her family, though as soon as they were out of sight, the two of them dispensed with their act. However, Neil had not thought about what to do after this point.

"Sorry Cille, I didn't think far enough ahead. I can't afford to rent a hotel room or anything, and I can't go home since my family wouldn't recognize me."

"It's alright, if the need arises, I will make a small barrier that we can hide in for the night. Have you decided who you want to see next?"

Neil remained silent for a moment, still focused on the street sidewalk in front of him. Cille did the same. It was only after they reached the next block when Neil responded.

"Cille?"

"Yes?"

"You said that when we're in the other world, Aldeltia, that time here stops, right?"

"That's right. If we left now and then came back after many years in Aldeltia, it would still be this night."

"I think that it might be easier if I go into the caves and return before anyone realizes that I'm gone."

"Then do you want to go back now, Neil?"

"No, there's one thing I need to do first."
11531121111.title: Continue

12.content:
You have chosen female teenager. Now who?

Mary Sims: 16 years old, shoulder-length blonde hair, blue eyes, caucasian?

Isabella Ramirez: 15 years old, long black hair, brown eyes, slightly Hispanic?
12.title: Female Teenager

choices: It is your mother, wishing you luck.
It is a soilder, bringing grave news.
121.content:
Finally, it was my day to shine. Being the only child of my familiy, I was next in line to the throne my parents currently occupied. Today was the day when I would be officially reconized as heir, the day in my life that I had been waiting for since I was born sixteen years ago.

I was only slightly nervous when my hand-maiden clasped my hair up in a criclet braid on the top of my head. The feeling of butterflies encompased my bowels, strangely, because this is truly wanted. My dress, hand made for the occassion, brought out my icey, sharp blue eyes that everyone complimented so often. Knowing that I must look confident for my (soon to be) people, I brought a grin to my face, looking as poised as possible for a moment like this.

Hearing a knock sounding at the door, both my hand-maiden Elizabeth and I were startled. "Come in."
121.title: Mary Sims

choices: There has been an invasion on their kingdom
1211.content:
My Mother looking as beautiful as ever came in. I was so nervous and excited I wasnt sure how to feel all these mixed emotions I felt all at once. My mother came to me and began to put the finishing touches on my hair. "You are so beautiful my dear you will do great and they wll all adore you more than ever" my mother told me calming my nerves. "Oh mother I am so nevous im not sure if i'll be what the people expect." My dear you will be more than what the people expect" "Oh I sure hope so mother". "Now your father is waiting as is the kingdom you should be going now" "I will be right there, just a few more minute." "That very fine".

Now that I was left alone I could get my thoughts together. I have waited so long for this but also came so much responsiabilty. I took out my journal before I left to jolt down a few of my wandering thoughts. As I begin to write in came my frantic head maiden and also forbidden bestfriend "Mary Mary Something terriable has happen you must hurry" ....
1211.title: It is your mother, wishing you luck.

choices: our wizard has found a old scroll with a huge family secret
12113.content: Now that I was left alone I could get my thoughts together. I have waited so long for this but also came so much responsiabilty. I took out my journal before I left to jolt down a few of my wandering thoughts. As I begin to write in came my frantic head maiden and also forbidden bestfriend "Mary Mary Something terriable has happen you must hurry" ....
12113.title: Your own idea

choices: Go about your day as normal
1213.content:
The doors burst open as a squire of 16 sprinted into the brightly lit room. Out of breath, boy put his hands on his knees as he struggled to speak. He was dressed quite nicely for a squire of my soon-to-be kingdom, and if a squire came from another kingdom it must be important.

"Princess my master, Sir Hughes of Horaim, has sent me with an urgent message. His spies in the realm of Sir Arthur brought back word recently that he was planning an attack on your kidnap the future ruler. Since you are the only heir to the throne, all of his forces will be set on taking you captive. I am to secretly take you to a hidden castle built by my master. You may bring your hand-maiden as a companion but we must act quickly! The king and queen will soon be informed by an ally of Sir Hughes as soon as possible. Hurry milady, for the enemy is surrounding the kingdom walls as we speak!"

Do you believe the young squire and go with him, call the guards, or tell him to leave and go about your day as usual?
1213.title: It is someone else.

choices: Doesn't get the chance to meet the king
123.content:
Rose Jacobs stared out over the city as the light was starting to fade. She had been riding non-stop for nearly thirty-six hours. Her horse was exhausted, as was she. She sighed and dismounted, she would wait in this small forrest until the next day. There was a small stream to her right, she led the horse to it. The horse in turn starting gulping down water as fast as she could. Rose smiled. "Easy, girl." she stroked the giant black animals main affectionately. "I'm sorry we couldn't stop sooner." She sighed again, "Midnight, what are we going to do?" She shook her head, "This seemed like a good idea yesterday, but the king isn't know for his kindness."

The horse merely continued to drink. She sat down and cupped her hands to get a drink. No need to worry about it now, she decided.
123.title: Rose Jacobs: 17, long, curly black hair, blue eyes

choices: the king refuses to let it go
1231.content:
King James looked down at the young, beautiful woman. She was asking for help for her small village. The king had absolutely no intention of granting her request, but was trying to think of way to phrase his refusal. He took a deep breath and spoke, "I am sorry, Rose, there is nothing I can do, but--"

She cut him off, "Nothing you can do? How can you even think that? You have an army at your disposal, sitting on their hands! You sit here, perfectly safe while people in your kingdom are suffering! You don't even care! The selfishness in even a sentence as simple that is astounding!"

"How dare you interrupt me? And insult me as well! Guards seize her! She can wait in the dungeons until I think up a propper punishment!"

Just then, Prince Trevor walked in. He was tall, about six feet, with light brown hair and eyes so dark they looked black. He looked around as the guards seized a young woman who stood in the middle of the room. She pulled against their grips but it was no use, their grips were like iron. "Woah, what's going on here?"

"This young lady has just paid me an unbelievable insult."

"Unbelievable," she snarled in a voice that seemed to sing like wind through trees, "all I spoke was the truth! It only insulted you because you know it! You have no idea the damage you're causing!"

The young prince walked around the guards to stand next to his father, he was just passing them when he froze. He saw the young girl's face. He knew it well. He had met this girl in the forrest when he was on a hunt a while back. She had saved the life of both him and his small party. She didn't seem to recognize him, or see him.

He shook his head and continued on. "How exactly did she insult you, father?"

"I told him that he was impossibly selfish. Only such a person could sit in his perfect safety and refuse to offer a fraction of that protection to save people dieing in his kingdom."

"Father, she is obviously only worried about the welfare of her people. Her words were probably produced out of fear, guilt, anger, and worry. Can you not let her words go this once?"
1231.title: Granted audience with the king

12312.content:
"I will not," the king demanded angrily. "How can you ask such things of me son?"

The prince thought deeply about this. Could he reveal his secret to his father? Could he imagine the horrid things they could do to this beautiful woman with hair of raven and eyes of sapphire?

"Father release her to my care. Make me responsible for her," the prince finally demanded.

The king thought for a moment.

"No man is ruler over me, especially a hopeless coward," she began to spat at the king before the breath-taking prince stood before her.

"Hold your tongue woman. I am trying my hardest to save your head but if it keeps going I will not be able to save you do you understand? If not I shall paint a better picture for you. Your head will role the more your mouth rambles."

The king was impressed but still wondered what he should do.
12312.title: the king refuses to let it go

choices: Keep trying to speak to the king tonight
Come back tomorrow during the day
Forget the king and try another way to solve the problem
1232.content:
The next morning, Rose mounted Midnight again and continued down to where the capital city of Demaria lay. She had to go slowly on the steep track going down, but once she reached the plains around the city, she cantered all the way to the city gate. Blending in with traders, villagers, and other travelers, Rose had no problem getting into Demaria, but she looked up worriedly towards the castle at the center of the city. Already the sky was beginning to darken. The king would hardly be receiving anyone at night. Rose tried to hasten, but try as she might, Midnight could not move very fast in the crowds and alleys of the city.

The stars were beginning to show by the time Rose drew up outside the castle walls. She leaped off her horse, sparing a few seconds to rub Midnight's nose. Then she walked up to the broad doors and looked around, unsure what to do. "Hello?" she called. Suddenly a small slit in the door opened and two eyes peered out.

"Yes? What do you require at the king's gate?"

"Please, I would like to speak to the king," she said, hoping she didn't sound too uncouth or desperate. There was silence for a few seconds.

"I am afraid that is not possible." The slit slid closed before she could respond.

"Please?" she asked forlornly, not sure if anyone could even here her.
1232.title: Doesn't get the chance to meet the king

12322.content:
Rose stood outside the silent doors for a few minutes, hoping against hope that they would relent. Inside, she knew there was no chance, but she also used the time to wonder what she was going to do. She could try again tomorrow. Surely the king must have audiences to hear his people. She sighed. If that didn't work...but there was no point going there right now.

"Alright Midnight, let's find a place to sleep." She led the horse away from the castle entrance. No doubt the city was replete with inns, but with her small budget, it would be difficult to get a place to rest somewhere safe. Not to mention she wasn't sure how to find the inns. A low growl reminded her that she hadn't eaten properly for over two days. Rose glanced wistfully at the dim lights that shone from houses lining the road. If only, if only, if only...

After wandering the streets for what felt like an hour, Rose found herself outside an open doorway with conversation, light, and the smell of pork spilling out onto the streets. Above it, a sign hung: "Crown's Head". Her stomach rumbled again, and Rose gulped and glanced at Midnight. "Well," she asked the horse, "what do you think? Should we stay here?"
12322.title: Finding a palce to sleep

choices: Rose is joined at her table by the bard
Rose goes to sleep for the night
123221.content:
Midnight nuzzled her neck and grunted. "I'll take that as a yes." Rose smiled at the horse, glad to have its companionship. Having decided, she walked determinedly to the stable attached to the inn. A small boy ran up, but she quickly indicated that she didn't need any help. She couldn't spare even the few small coins for his service. After settling Midnight in for the night, Rose walked back to the doorway and, taking a deep breath, entered into the premises.

No one noticed her at first, as all the attention was focused on a bard playing a jig in a corner. However, a thin woman sporting a clean apron soon approached, her face drawn and lined with stress and age. "Welcome to the Crown's Head, ma'am. What would you be wanting?"

"How-How much for a room?"

The woman looked doubtful. "Well, I don't know that we've got room, on accounts of the caravan that just arrived today."

"Oh." Rose suddenly felt very tired.

The woman continued to stare at her doubtfully, and then glanced up and down to seize her up. "Well, I guess you could share with my girl for the night and I'll only charge you one pont for that."

"Thank you so much," Rose said gratefully.

"You be wantin' something to eat?" the woman asked, brushing aside the thanks in the simple way of kind people.

"Yes please."

"Sit yourself down over there-" she pointed at an empty table away from the door, "and I'll bring something right out."

"Thank you," Rose said again, and then settled into the chair indicated by her hostess. Now that she could rest, she found herself smiling at the lively antics of the bard. He had the crowd roaring with laughter at a comedic rendition of how a blind man kissed a horse, thinking it to be his shrewish wife.

"Here you go, dear." The proprietress appeared at her elbow with a steaming plate heaped with food. Rose dug in, pacing herself to enjoy every warm bite after the past two nights out in the cold.
123221.title: The Crown's Head

124.content:
"When the earth was created, the only beings were animals. Then the gods created man. Four regions of the world were created, Agui in the south, Flur in the West, Gobi in the East, and Mont in the North. When man became unhappy with his life, the gods turned on him. But there was one, a goddess, the goddess of song, who was compassionate and wise. the knew the cause of mans unhappiness. She came to Earth and gave him woman. This goddess, Modi, was the most divine creature that man had ever seen, and he called her queen. Modi was given a palace where the regions meet. She was the ruler. She married a mortal, and gave birth to two daughters. But her mortal body became week, and soon she died. The eldest of the princesses, who could never sing before, suddenly had her mothers talent, and it was believed that the spirit of Modi had been passed to her, and she was the rightful queen. For thousands of years, when a queen dies, the spirit of Modi passes to the eldest of the queens daughters."

It was a story that Tia had heard many times growing up. Her sister had told her, and she had told her masters children. But she never thought it would happen to her.
124.title: Tia

choices: While travelling, the entourage is attacked in the forest.
They reach Agui safely and quickly and Tia prepares for marriage.
They reach Agui swiftly and Tia plans her escape.
1241.content:
Tia stared out over the farmlands. She could see for miles from her perch on the tower's roof. The door inside slammed open, and she pulled her feet higher up. She rested her chin on her knees and closed her eyes, knowing that it would be Christopher. And it was. He leaned out the window and stared up at her, his blond hair ruffling in the wind.

"Tia?"

His voice was deep and melancholy. She sighed and glanced at him quickly before continuing to study the land. Her green eyes sparkled as tears began to fill them, and she hid her face in her dress. Christopher paused a moment, doubt flickering in his mind, before climbing on to the roof next to Tia. They'd grown up together in the farmlands. Tia had always been willing to run and play with the boys, and Christopher had always been willing to let her. They were best friends and, as a result, he knew she was terrified and didn't want to go through with any of it.

"What's wrong?" he asked quietly.

She was silent, her shoulders shaking with sobs. After a few minutes she breathed in deeply and looked at him. A strand of curly brown hair escaped from its braid and fluttered around her face before she tucked it back in.

"Do you remember tha farmlands?" she whispered. He nodded. "All the other girls would stare at me, call me silly or stupid, because I didn't want to be a princess. And they did. Why couldn't they have come to the castle and looked after the king's children? Why did he choose me? And why do I have to do this now? I don't want to."


They sat in silence again, Christopher unable to think of an answer that would comfort her, and Tia preparing herself for the impossible task of being princess. She stood suddenly, spread her arms and let the wind hold her for a moment, before climbing off of the roof and back into the castle's tower, where the prince's men were waiting to accompany her back to Agui.
1241.title: Doubts

choices: Say 'yes' and follow him into a side room.
125.content:
I glanced in the looking glass as Shaska, my maiden, soothed the last of my rebellious dark hair around the braided gold circlet on my head. I had hair the colour of ravens wings - many had said that it was as dark as the night. Tears slipped down my bronzed cheeks from blue eyes. Those lily coloured eyes had been the cause of much wooing from nobles in the past, as much as I hated it, but today the lily had turned to a sea of tears. It was not everyday that my good father, the great king of all Palistia, died. Now tears flowed freely. Nothing in Palistia would ever be the same again.

I smoothed my blue silk dress, the colour of mourning in Palistia, rose gracefully and walked to the door. I was followed by a train of maidens, also in mourning blue. Philip, my faithful guard, fell in step behind me and my maids respectfully distanced themselves from him. The palace at Susawa was the greatest in Palistia. Great marble pillars flanking the hallway towered high into the roof. Windows as tall as three men on top of each other stood proud on my right - this was only a small corridor in a small wing of the majestic palace.

We swept past the pillars and windows, across the glassy surface until we came to a stairway. My mind was dull with grief and anxiety. My brother was now the King of Palistia, yet he was young - only sixteen summers - and inexperienced in this dangerous world. He knew more than me, his little fifteen-year-old sister, but I knew that we were both in a very dangerous situation. We had not been able to speak privately together since our father's death, but I was sure he thought the same as me: our father was murdered.

We reached the foot of the staircase and I paused as Medrek stepped out from beside a pillar and approached. He was the only person left in the world apart from my brother whom I trusted. Standing six feet five, he could be rather intimidating with his massive bulk, but he had kind eyes and a gentle face.

"Mara." He was one of few in the kingdom who could call me that. I liked the way my name rolled off his tongue, but I brushed such thoughts aside. He was serious. He wanted my attention. "May I speak to you about something?"
125.title: Mara, daughter of Lervor, King of Palistia

1251.content:
Now was not the time to speak to Medrek. I did not have time. I had to go down to mourn my father, as was the tradition of Palistia, and continue to do so for seven days after his funeral. I had five more days.

"Leave me alone," I muttered and continued on, my servants following me. He seemed to hesitate, then followed us at a distance.

I remembered mourning my mother and her baby son many years ago. The occasion had not been so grand as a king's death, but she had meant much to me. My sandaled feet clicked on the cold stone as I descended another flight of stairs. I would go to the little garden temple to mourn my father today. The garden temple was my favourite place to mourn and be alone. It was so comforting down there.

I continued up another corridor before reaching a half-room opening out onto a garden. This was my little garden. I wandered through the garden, the gentle evening breeze caressing my honeyed skin. A fountain, a serene pool, some birds singing in nearby trees, and a stone path leading to a temple. The great golden pillars were not as big as those in the palace, but they were nonetheless grand. I walked up the stairs and a priest advanced to meet me. Along either side of the room were statues of different precious metals and woods, and at the end an alter. A sacred silence hung respectfully over the whole building.

I exchanged some words with the priest and advanced slowly to the alter. My servants and the priest remained behind me, the women kneeling on the ground in traditional lamenting, and the priest stood, his eyes closed, waving his hands over the scene and murmuring - I knew he was praying to the gods for my father's soul.

I knelt before the alter and bowed my head. Oh, Samika, beautiful goddess, be with the spirits of my parents. Watch over us and bring peace on the palace and the whole realm. Do not deny your blessing on my and my brother's head. Please be -

There was a shriek and I spun around. Ten guards, armed with swords and spears, had burst into the temple and were advancing on me. I knew they had come to kill me.
1251.title: Say 'no' and keep walking.

12512.content:
This was it! This was the end. Miracles didn't work anymore. I was about to die. But I did not care. I would go to be with my father and my mother and my baby brother. Samika, Samika, accept my soul!

They were very close now. I clung to the alter with all my strength, tears streaming down my face.

Father, I love you! I go to be with you!

One of the guards threw his spear at me but he missed and it bounced off the golden alter. My fingers ran over the silky surface of Samika's figure on the side of the alter. I kissed it.

Pain shot through my body like fire and I reeled. I knew someone had stabbed me as my eyesight went foggy and I tasted my own blood. Fire burned through my body as they kept stabbing me. Slowly my eyes closed. I was glad to leave this cruel world, to go to embrace my father, my mother, my brother. My royal body went limp.

Oh, this blissful oblivion! Samika...Father...Mother...my brother...
12512.title: Stay clinging to the alter

choices: Tell Medrek you will be fine and go on your way
Agree that you will go with Medrek
1252.content:
I hesitated. Why would Medrek want to speak to me? Why choose this moment when I was going to mourn my father? But I trusted him and I knew he would not speak to me now unless it was urgent. I nodded, ordered my servants to wait outside and followed Medrek through a side door. Beyond it was just a little room, furnished with a desk and some shelves of scrolls. He indicated a seat beside the tall window and I sat down, my posture straight as I had always been taught.

He remained standing and went straight to the point.

"Mara, all is not safe in the palace. There are traitors around every corner ready to seize the throne. You and your brother must flee the palace. There is no time. I am giving the choice: come and live or stay and die."
1252.title: Say 'yes' and follow him into a side room.

12521.content:
Now was not the time to speak to Medrek. I did not have time. I had to go down to mourn my father, as was the tradition of Palistia, and continue to do so for seven days after his funeral. I had five more days.

"Leave me alone," I muttered, stood and left the room. He followed me out, protesting angrily. I motioned to my servants and continued on. Medrek seemed to hesitate, then followed us at a distance.

As we swept down the corridor, I remembered mourning my mother and her baby son many years ago. The occasion had not been so grand as a king's death, but she had meant much to me. My sandaled feet clicked on the cold stone as I descended another flight of stairs. I would go to the little garden temple to mourn my father today. The garden temple was my favourite place to mourn and be alone. It was so comforting down there.

I continued up another corridor before reaching a half-room opening out onto a garden. This was my little garden. I wandered through the garden, the gentle evening breeze caressing my honeyed skin. A fountain, a serene pool, some birds singing in nearby trees, and a stone path leading to a temple. The great golden pillars were not as big as those in the palace, but they were nonetheless grand. I walked up the stairs and a priest advanced to meet me. Along either side of the room were statues of different precious metals and woods, and at the end an alter. A sacred silence hung respectfully over the whole building.

I exchanged some words with the priest and advanced slowly to the alter. My servants and the priest remained behind me, the women kneeling on the ground in traditional lamenting, and the priest stood, his eyes closed, waving his hands over the scene and murmuring - I knew he was praying to the gods for my father's soul.

I knelt before the alter and bowed my head. Oh, Samika, beautiful goddess, be with the spirits of my parents. Watch over us and bring peace on the palace and the whole realm. Do not deny your blessing on my and my brother's head. Please be -

There was a shriek and I spun around. Ten guards, armed with swords and spears, had burst into the temple and were advancing on me. I knew they had come to kill me.
12521.title: Tell Medrek you will be fine and go on your way

choices: Take the center path and hope the palace hasn't been seized
Take the right path and brave the forest
125211.content:
Out of the corner of my eye, I saw the priest open a hidden side door. He ushered my maids through as I ran towards it.

As I ran into the semi-darkness of the passageway, I noticed him grab a pike, the sacred weapon of our realms priests. The door slammed shut behind me, and I followed my maids towards the exit. The passage was stone, and it was just tall enough to fit an average human. My father's sorcerer had equipped the walls with magic torches that burned eternally.

We reached a crossroads of other secret passages. A web of intricate tunnels ran through the castle. My ancestors commissioned them for an attack like this one.

The passage on the left would take us to pub in the town, owned by one of my father's most trusted citizens. The center one led right to the center of the palace. The passage on the right was dangerous, but it led to a secret tree in the ancient, impenetrable Dark Forest next to the kingdom.

We turned left to exit the safest passage. Suddenly, voices echoed from that direction. I knew they weren't allies like I knew my father was murdered.
125211.title: Run through a side door

choices: Have a heart attack and die
12522.content:
I thought a moment about Medrek's offer, gazing out over the massive white city of Susawa, to the west where the sun was sinking low on the horizon. Flee the palace! Leave my home! Abandon the throne! But I knew Medrek was right. "Has my brother agreed?" I asked.
"Yes."
I nodded slowly in acceptation. Medrek was right. I must go with him. My loyalty lay with my brother, Medrek, my country, the memory of my father. "Yes, I will go."
"Very well. We have little time. We leave immediately. When we leave this room, you must order all except one of your servants to stay where they are. Is your guard reliable?"
"Yes, Philip is loyal to me until death. He has saved my life before and that is why my father made him my personal guard."
"Order him to follow you. Let me do everything else."
I nodded, stood up, my silk dress gathering coolly on my skin.

He followed me to the door, opened it and I proceeded him out. Doing as he had advised, I told my servants to stay where they were and ordered Philip to follow me. He did so gladly. Faithful Philip! He would never leave me, even if it cost him his life!

We turned up another corridor and I slowed down to step in behind Medrek. Philip raised an eyebrow at this submission - after all, I was a princess, the only daughter of the great king Mashania of Philistia - but did not comment.

I thought I knew the palace well, but Medrek led us up and down so many corridors and staircases that even I was confused and hopelessly lost. I was very thankful that I was with these two men. I knew they were faithful and I could trust them. I longed to see my brother, Azad, to embrace him and to speak to him. He was all I had left, now.
12522.title: Agree that you will go with Medrek

12523.content:
I was shocked, devastated. I could not go! What could I do? My lungs were tortured as I gasped for breath. I could not face change! I could not live without the comfort! Suddenly I longed to see my father, to escape this mad world, to forget Medrek's words. I shook my head in disbelief.

I stood and looked out the window. There was the beautiful city of the kings of Palistia: Susawa. It was my father's city. My grandfather's city. It was the city of my ancestors. I could no longer bear the pain. My father!

I leaped for the window. Out of the corner of my eye I caught Medrek's shocked look, his raised hand to stop me, but he was too late. The glass shattered and suddenly there was nothing but air and I was falling...falling...falling...

THE END
12523.title: Jump out the window

133111.content:
This is a great opportunity. You rarely get to go on vacation, and this will be out of the country. You email them back that you will be going and start getting ready. You take leave, have your daughter stay with your wife, and pack everything up.

In about a week you get on the plane and start flying over. Not only did they pay for your tickets, they also bought you first class. With the great seating and the free alcohol the 12 hour flight felt much shorter. Before long you were in Tokyo/Narita. You then got on a small turbo prop headed to the island.

Once you get off the plane, you see a tall attractive woman in a dress holding a sign, "Yakeda Koichi."

"Ma'am, I believe you are looking for me."

"Yes, Koichi-san. Your bags will be taken seperately, follow me to the car."

"Thank you."

You follow her to the car, a Lincoln Town Car, and she drives you to your family's home. When you arrive you see that it is almost a palace. Back in the United States it would easily be called a mansion. She pulled up in front of the main entrance and stopped.

"Here is your new home."

"Again, thank you."

As you get out of the car you think about her wording "your new home," that is weird, you are here just for a short bit. Well, it might just be the language barrier, and you let it fade from your mind. Standing just outside of the entryway are two men in suits and a woman in a kimono. The older of the two men appears to be about 60 years old, and both the younger man and the woman appear to be in their twenties.

"Hello, Koichi." The older man says. "I am your Uncle, Daisuke. This is your cousin, Noburu and his wife, Aiko. Welcome to our home."

"Thank you sir." You respond.

"You are very welcome. Come, let's give you a tour of the house."

You walk up the stairs and he let's you into the house. The house seems somehow even bigger on the inside. You never knew a home could have so many rooms. Some are devoted to family heirlooms, including two full sets of samurai armor. No matter where you go however, a servant is not far. Most are cleaning, but others are standing by in case a family member would require assistance. The tour ends at your room. It is incredibly comfortable looking, but also quite feminine, must be because it is a guest room.

"If you would like, you can rest. You must be incredibly jet lagged."

You only just noticed, now that he's brought it up.

"Thank you, I think I will."

Once he has left you get undressed and go to sleep.

1331112.content:
You wake up to find yourself strapped to a gurney in a brightly lit hospital room.

"What the hell. What's happening."

"Calm down." Daisuke responds, you see that he is sitting beside you. "Or else I won't explain what's happening."

What is he doing here?

"Alright, alright." You respond quietly. "What is happening."

"Well, you should be first in line to receive the crown on the death of your grandfather, but I've been here, when your father died, I thought I would receive it. I would have too, up until I saw your email. Luckily I caught it before my father. I knew I couldn't hide you forever, however there is one loophole in succession. You have to be a man, and since I am not willing to have you killed. I will simply render you unfit for succession."

As you try to contemplate what is happening you feel a prick, and it all goes dark.

...

You slowly regain your senses. You are back in your bed it must have been a dream. But when you look up you see you are sadly mistaken, it happened and it was finished. You get up and look in the mirror, they were thorough, someone would be insane to think you were previously a man. You have no hair save that on your head, your eyebrows and a small patch pointing to your biggest change. They somehow changed your entire body type, from fairly straight from top to bottom, to a slight hourglass, extenuated by your Double D breasts. Even your face is completely different, now you legitimately feel you are cute, with big eyes, soft lips, and a subtle nose.

As you start to get chilly, you decide to get some clothes. There are some in the wardrobe. Regrettably, all of the underwear is full blown lingerie. You grab some lilac lace and put them on. Now you look for some day to day clothes, but you can't even find any pant. You look in the closet and realize you only have dresses. You find a sleeveless red floral dress with an oriental color, decide it looks good, and put it on.
1331112.title: You are kidnapped by fellow members of the Yake...

You hear knocking at the door.

"Who is it?" You ask in your newly feminine voice.

"Aiko." She responds.

You wonder why she is coming over.

"Alright, come on in."

She walks in. Now she is wearing a skirt and blouse.

"I'm so sorry about what they did to you." She says as she closes the door behind her. "I tried to talk them out of it, I really did."

She seems incredibly sincere. "It's okay I believe you." You respond.

"Thanks, would you like any help in your transition? I've had a bit of experience with it." She chuckles.

"Thanks. You seem really nice. Why would you marry the sort of guy who would take part in this."

"Don't worry about him. The plan was all Daisuke's, Noboru couldn't do anything about it. He really is quite nice." She leans in to whisper, "and he's got a great cock."

The last comment throws you off, but she seems both sincere and kind.

"I wouldn't know..."

"Of course not. But well, you might try to warm to the idea, homosexuality isn't very accepted in the family or in other royal lines." You become visibly distraught at the realization. "Let's change the subject, you look uncomfortable. You will be going through some training soon. Pay attention, the sooner you learn it all, the sooner you can live semi-normally."

"Alright, I can do that." You respond.

"Actually, your first class is coming soon. We'll talk again later."

What is it?

1412.content:
You watched from your upstairs bedroom window as your parents chatted with your former high school friend's mother. You were very careful however, not to be visible to her. The last thing you wanted was for this woman to know you were still living at home. Of course, it wasn't unlikely that your parents would bring it up in their conversation anyway as if it were no big deal. Still, the least you could do was preserve the idea in your head that no one but your parents and yourself knew your current living situation.

All your friends had gone off to college. Some of them were already kickstarting their careers. You had tried that, but your own insecurities and fear of failure led you down a dark rabbit hole and back to your parents house. No college degree, no job training, no career. Your mother treated it as if you were experiencing a slight set back and acted as if you'd be back on your feet at any given moment. Your father however did not hold back his disappointment. He kept reminding you that your situation at home was temporary and that you WOULD be leaving after a certain amount of time had left, whether you had your shit together or not. The truth was, you had absolutely no idea which direction you were going to take in your life. The future terrified you.

An abrupt knock at the door pulled you away from your self pitying thoughts. How strange, you thought. Could my parents be done talking already? You took a brief glance out the window. Your parents were still chatting away with your former friend's mother. Who could be at my door then? You wondered.

You quickly smoothed your hair, and made sure you did not look like a basement dweller and walked over to your bedroom door. When you opened it however, there was no one on the other side. Just an empty space and the stairs a few feet away. You shut the door, wondering if you were imagining things when the knocking sounded you again, startling you. This time you realized the knocking was not coming from your bedroom door. It was coming from your closet!

On one hand you were dumbfounded at the situation. On the other hand you wanted to run downstairs and call the police. BANG BANG BANG

That night, your mother the Queen and you are having a quiet dinner (she makes a point to have at least one meal with you each day) why you've changed without noticing it.

"What was the most challenging thing you did today?" She asks,
smiling.

"I almost got a hit in on Master Tofoya," you say, referring to the swordsmaster.

"And did you have time to worry about whether you are a boy or a girl when you were fighting?"

"Are you kidding, his blade is sharp?"

"So if you were thinking about other things, like the fact that each day, you're becoming more my daughter, you would get stabbed."

You think on this and a light comes on. Mom smiles at you. "Your keeping me busy so I don't think about it."

"Your thinking about it now, Erin," She laughs,

"Yeah..." you pause putting it together in your mind, "I am, so that can't be all of it. I sure am doing a lot."

"Did you ever do so much before," Mum asks.

"No, I was just a regular boy."

"And did you know you could do all this?"

"No----I."

"Your getting, it dearheart."

"I didn't know."

"And knowing, do you wish to unknow."

"Course not," and you think of all the ways you've changed, both physically and mentally. Your not the same as you were, and you don't want to be as you were.

"Not unless you ask me to, and perhaps not even then," she answers the question.

"Why?" you ask after another pause.

"Because that's what makes me different from those people who tried to enspell you, and a long time ago me, I suppose. I didn't much like it."

"I hardly noticed they had changed me."

"When I was your age, they were less........refined," Julia spits out that last word and for the first time since the castle you see the fire within her.

There is another pause as you watch the world continue along the road.

"What's going to happen to me next?"

"We'll travel for about a week, long enough to know if we're being tracked."

"And then?"

"During that trip, before we go to sleep, we'll do a divination each night in order to find the proper place for you."

"Oh." And with that you and Julia companionably travel down the road. Each night you do a divanation, a different each night. The first night it's runes based off of questions she asks you. The next night she just asks you questions, some them odd (your favorite food, the "best" type of rain), the third night, she goes into a trance.

Each time, oddly you feel more and more like the questions are leading you to the "right" place for the you you're becoming. At the end of a week you trust her completely.

1511321221.content: You see a long pair of ruby opera gloves on the ground, they are a little dirty and with a few rips, but they immediately catch your attention and can't stop look at them. They are near a trash bin, "Maybe they are fallen off." you think. You starting to grab them to put inside the bin, but when you touch them they glow for an instant. You put away your hand like you were scared, "What the-". Nothing... Nothing happened, and you start to think that maybe you have imagined all. Again you try to grab them to throw them away, but you stop for a second and without even thinking you grab them and put inside your backpack.
1511321221.title: a ruby pair of gloves

15113212211.content:
During a lesson you start boring yourself and begin thinking about the gloves you found in the morning. You are so curious to try them on and want to know how they feel, when suddenly your right hand feel strange, you give a quick look and start to panic. You are wearing a glove!
How happened?! When happened?! You rapidly hide your hand between your legs hoping no one see. You turn around your head and breathe a sigh of relief when you find that no one was looking to your direction.
Very slowly you grab the glove and start to remove it while you continuing look around to not to be catch. Finally you remove the glove and re-put inside you backpack.
"What the hell happened? Why i was wearing a glove? I don't remember wearing one..." you continue thinking, but simply you can't figure it out.

The rest of the school go smoothly and after a while you forgot what happened.
15113212211.title: During school.

151132122111.content:
At home you relax on the sofa and start watching tv, when suddenly you remember about the gloves, "The gloves right! Mom don't come back until dinner so i have time to...".

You and your mother are the only member of the family, your dad died long time ago in a car accident, but you and your mother are no longer sad about his missing,
on the contrary, this helped to be more close and very supportive each other. When your mother is late because of her work you cook dinner or order a pizza, so when she come home have always a big smile on her face. You also help her with the housework.

You turn off the tv and go to your room, open the backpack... "I have time so i can clean them", you grab the gloves and go to the bathroom.

After a while, "Wow, they were really dirty!" now the gloves are almost shiny, so red, so sexy... "Too bad they are ruined, fortunately no too much", you continue staring at them "I want to try them", the touch... so smooth... like silk. Like charmed you starting to wear them... and getting a little excited.

You start admiring your gloved hands... your arms... "I love them!" *Giggle* and again the gloves glow for an instant, but this time you don't see that.
151132122111.title: At home.

1511321221111.content:
"I don't want to remove them now, i'll keep them a little longer", with that think you leave the bathroom and start doing your homework.

After a moment you notice that your hands feel strange, looking at what you write, you notice that your writing seems different... almost.... girly.... "Those gloves aren't made for writing, they are so constricting that i can't write like always... Maybe it's better if i take them off now..." a little regretting you start pull them off, but... "Uh?", they don't came off, "They seems stuck, maybe the sweat glue them on" and with that you start pull harder and harder.

It take you almost 5 minute to take them off but finally you are free... "Fortunately they don't ripped off more than before..." you look at them, "Uh? I was almost certain that the gloves were more ruined... Mmmm..... Oh well, better for me.". Looking at the clock you see that is almost dinner time, "Better go cook something", you place the gloves under your pillow and go to the kitchen to make dinner.

15113212211111.content:
During the night while you sleep, the gloves glows again, but this time more brightly than before. The rips vanish and suddenly the gloves come to life and start fly toward you. They sneak under your blankets and crawls on your legs until they reach your arms, and like snakes, they start "eat" your hands.

You are feeling a little uncomfortable and slowly you wake up, rubbing your eye, something seems strange... But what? "Mmmm", you turn on the bed and try to sleep again..... "My hand!" a funny, but familiar, feeling make you jump on the bed and reach for the light switch.

When you light up the room, the feeling becomes disgust, and the disgust becomes panic.... You are wearing the gloves! Why? When? And when the panic becomes unbearable.... "A-" your gloved hands prevents you from screaming, but this builds up more panic than before....

"My hands! I can't control them! The gloves! Those gloves are controlling my hands!" with this thought you tries to scream again, hoping to wake up your mom. But no luck, she is a heavy sleeper, hardly she wakes up during the night.

"What i can do?! What they want from me?".... After a few minutes of pure panic you calm down, you are tired from all that screaming, and they didn't move from your mouth all the time, they are like stuck.
"They will never let me scream, but they can't control all my body.... I hope so..... If i stand up and reach the door, i can go to my mom's room and wake her", with that you get out of bed and walk to the door, but one hand go down, grab one leg and pull up really hard, you didn't expect this and suddenly you find yourself looking the ceiling of your room.

"What happened?!", now on the floor, the gloved hand that grabbed your leg now is keeping your head down so now you can't talk and escape.

You try on the glove, that now fits perfectly. You hold it up to examine it and sign as it glitters in the light and when you take it off you marvel how perfectly it fits you, again not noticing the glow. You put it under your pillow and then you go back to doing your homework.

Your handwriting matches the delicate script you were writing in before dinner, though you notice nothing amiss. When you sleep, the glove glows under the pillow. You have very sweet dreams.

You wake up in the morning, refreshed and content. As you get ready for the day,
